title: Why is a car seat headrest detachable? - Quora

response.answer_text: I believe that they are not designed to be detachable, but they are designed to be adjustable. In order to do their job of cushioning and supporting the head then the head should be at the middle of the headrest. Given the wide range of heights of potential car users, they have to be adjustable. Being removable is a by-product of the simple adjustment system used. I'm not sure it's an intended feature. Having said that, removing my passenger head rest made it easier to correctly fit a larger child seat. Bonus titbit. If you find yourself trapped in a car in an emergency, the metal headrest posts can be used to break a window to get out.

So that those of us who like to sit upright while driving can take the thing off and drop it in the back floorboard to be forgotten about until we return the rental car. Otherwise I’d be looking at my lap while driving, which is not a very safe thing to do.
